snippet: All nine judges on the Constitution Tribunal, appointed by President Thein Sein, abruptly resigned Thursday after the lower house of Parliament voted to impeach them.
abstract: All nine judges on the Constitution Tribunal, appointed by President Thein Sein of Myanmar, abruptly resign after the lower house of Parliament votes to impeach them; lawmakers had been angered that the tribunal had not granted parliamentary committees and commissions the legal status they sought.
lead_paragraph: All nine judges on the Constitution Tribunal, appointed by President Thein Sein, abruptly resigned Thursday after the lower house of Parliament voted to impeach them.
